checks.name: README Documentation
checks.description: Checks that the repository has a README file with meaningful content. A good README helps users understand what the project is and how to use it.

checks.name: License File
checks.description: Checks that the repository has a LICENSE file. Open source licenses clarify how others can use, modify, and distribute your code.
checks.stdout: LICENSE file found: LICENSE (1079 chars, detected: MIT)

checks.name: CI Configuration
checks.description: Checks that the repository has continuous integration configured. CI helps catch bugs early and ensures code quality.

checks.name: Test Coverage
checks.description: Checks that the repository has test files. Tests ensure code reliability and help prevent regressions.
checks.stdout: Found tests: 7 file(s) in directories: tests

checks.name: Scorecard Configuration
checks.description: Checks that the repository has a .scorecard/config.yml file with service metadata. This improves service discoverability in the catalog with team info, descriptions, and useful links.

checks.name: OpenAPI Specification
checks.description: Checks that the repository has an OpenAPI/Swagger specification file and that it is valid. Validates syntax and structure of API documentation.
checks.stdout:
OpenAPI specification found and validated: openapi.yaml
Title: Perfect Example API (v1.0.0)
OpenAPI version: 3.0.3
Endpoints: 3 paths, 4 operations

checks.name: OpenAPI Quality
checks.description: Evaluates the completeness and quality of the OpenAPI specification. Checks for descriptions, examples, schemas, and other documentation best practices.
checks.stdout:
OpenAPI Quality Score: 98/100

Quality Metrics:
  Info: ✓ description, ✓ contact, ✓ license
  Operations: 4 total
    - 4/4 (100%) with descriptions
    - 4/4 (100%) with tags
    - 2/4 (50%) with examples
  Parameters: 3/3 (100%) with descriptions
  Responses: 9/9 (100%) with descriptions
  Schemas: 4/4 (100%) with descriptions
  Security: ✓ defined, ✓ applied

Quality score meets threshold (60+)

checks.name: API Environment Configuration
checks.description: Checks that API services with OpenAPI specifications have environment configuration defined. Ensures deployment environments and base URLs are documented for API testing.
checks.stderr:
OpenAPI specification found, but no openapi section in .scorecard/config.yml
Add an openapi section with environments configuration

Example:
  openapi:
    spec_file: "openapi.yaml"
    environments:
      production:
        base_url: "https://api.example.com"
        description: "Production environment"

checks.name: Scorecard Badge
checks.description: Checks that the README displays scorecard badges. Badges promote transparency and help users quickly assess repository quality.
checks.stdout: Found scorecard badge(s) in README.md: 1 score badge(s) and 1 rank badge(s)

checks.name: Scorecard Config Quality
checks.description: Validates that .scorecard/config.yml contains meaningful service metadata beyond the basic template. Requires both team and description fields to be filled with actual content, ensuring the service is properly documented in the catalog.
checks.stdout:
Scorecard config has meaningful content:
  • Team: platform
  • Description: Reference implementation demonstrating all scorecards best practices for achievi...
  • Links: 1 configured

checks.name: CODEOWNERS File
checks.description: Checks that the repository has a CODEOWNERS file. CODEOWNERS enables automated code review assignment and clarifies maintenance responsibilities.

checks.name: CODEOWNERS Quality
checks.description: Validates that the CODEOWNERS file contains valid syntax with properly formatted ownership rules. Ensures code review automation will work correctly.
checks.stdout:
CODEOWNERS syntax validated: .github/CODEOWNERS
  1 ownership rule
  1 unique owner
  - * -> @feddericovonwernich-org/platform
